title: 2026 Grammys Share the Love Among Pop Winners Lola Young, Lady Gaga, Billie Eilish, Olivia Dean &¬†More
summary: On the new Billboard Pop Shop Podcast, Katie & Keith are talking about Sunday's show, where four different artists won in the Big Four categories.
body: There was a lot of pop love to go around at Sunday’s 2026 Grammy Awards , where four different artists won in the Big Four categories and the pop categories shared the wealth. Related Here Are the 2026 Grammys Winners: Full List It's Their Moment: Lady Gaga, 'Golden,' Sabrina Carpenter & More 2026 Grammy Pop Predictions From Harry's House to Harry's 'Disco': Harry Styles Is Back With a New Song & Album to Answer Our Pop Prayers While she lost best new artist to Olivia Dean, Lola Young was a surprise winner in best pop solo performance for “Messy.” And even though Cynthia Erivo & Ariana Grande’s “Defying Gravity” duet won for best pop duo/group performance, “Golden” from KPop Demon Hunters got its win elsewhere, for best song written for visual media. Lady Gaga might have missed out on a Big Four win, but she was still a two-time winner on Sunday night (best pop vocal album for MAYHEM and best dance pop recording for “Abracadabra”). And Billie Eilish even snagged an award for a track from her 2024 album, when “Wildflower” won song of the year. Listen to the ne‚Ä¶

title: Pandora Settles Lawsuit Over Royalties for Robin Williams, George Lopez & More Comedy¬†Routines
summary: The streamer says the deal doesn't alter its existing royalties structure for comedy sets.
body: Pandora has settled with comedians in a closely-watched legal dispute over spoken-word content licensing, though the streamer says it still isn‚Äôt paying the equivalent of publishing royalties sought in the comics‚Äô lawsuit. Nine comedians and their heirs, including George Lopez, Lewis Black and the estates of deceased legends Robin Williams and George Carlin , have been fighting since 2022 to increase the royalties paid when their comedy sets are streamed on Pandora. Lawyers for the comics and Pandora agreed on a confidential settlement during a court-refereed mediation on Wednesday (Jan. 28), court records show. Related Comedians Want Pandora to Pay More Royalties. A New Report Says It Doesn’t Need to The comedians‚Äô lawsuit had aimed to align their royalties structure with that of music streaming, where artists are paid for both sound recordings (masters) and the underlying written music (publishing). Comics have historically been paid digital streaming royalties only for their recorded comedy routines, not the underlying jokes themselves. The comedians did not ultimately achieve this goal, according to a spokesperson for Pandora‚Äôs parent company SiriusXM, who said in a‚Ä¶

title: Chappell Roan Is ‚ÄòGiggling‚Äô Over Reaction to Her Sheer Grammy Dress: ‚ÄòI Don‚Äôt Even Think This Is THAT Outrageous of an¬†Outfit‚Äô
summary: The pop singer/songwriter made headlines with the bold nipple-ring dress.
body: Chappell Roan is having a good laugh after her barely-there 2026 Grammys red-carpet outfit made headlines around the world on Sunday night. The controversial look — a custom maroon Mugler gown based on the designer’s 1998 nipple-ring dress — started out covered in a sheer cape before Roan shed the layer and unveiled the topless style. Related Chappell Roan Brings Back Mugler’s Nipple Ring Dress at the 2026 Grammys Here Are the 2026 Grammys Winners: Full List 2026 Grammys: Here's What You Didn't See on TV “Giggling because I don‚Äôt even think this is THAT outrageous of an outfit,” Roan captioned a carousel of photos posted to her Instagram on Monday (Feb. 2). “The look‚Äôs actually so awesome and weird. I recommend just exercising your free will it‚Äôs really fun and silly üòÄ Thank you for having me @grammys and those who voted for me!!” Billboard ‘s video of Roan on the red carpet from Sunday night is at a whopping 52 million views (and counting) on Instagram, with comments ranging from “I love her but this is too much. Is she gonna get banned?” to “Okay but she really ate this look up.” R‚Ä¶

title: Billboard‚Äôs Music Industry Events¬†Calendar
summary: A complete rundown of the most important events across the music business.
body: As part of our continuing efforts to serve the music industry and its creators, Billboard Pro now features a music industry events calendar for readers. The calendar will act as music’s most complete summary major national and international industry events, from conferences to festivals to networking mixers and more. Just as Billboard is music’s must-read source for news, charts and analysis, now it also is the go-to for business happenings. Related Dates Announced for SXSW London Debut Vans Warped Tour Reveals First Artists for 2026 After Ozzy's Death, Sharon Osbourne Is Still Changing The Music Industry: 'I'm Up 24 Hours a Day' February 2026 Jan. 15-Feb. 7 – Igloofest Montr√©al festival (Montreal) Feb. 5 – Warner Music Group earnings call Feb. 6-8 – Gem & Jam festival (Tucson, Ariz.) Feb. 7 – NAACP Image Awards Nominees Brunch (Los Angeles) Feb. 10 – Spotify Q4 earnings call Feb. 11-12 – Night Time Economy Summit (Liverpool, England) Feb. 12 – ASCAP Experience (Los Angeles) Feb. 14-16 – Bandland festival (Bengaluru, India) Feb. 17-19 – Music in Action Summit (Boulder, Colo.) Feb. 19-Mar‚Ä¶

title: Charli xcx Says ‚ÄòBrat‚Äô Era Opened Her Up to a ‚ÄòNew Audience‚Äô That ‚ÄòDidn‚Äôt Really Get¬†Me‚Äô
summary: The star added that some people "connected with me" and some "only connected with aspects of me."
body: Charli xcx ‘s 2024 Brat album changed her trajectory as an artist — but with it came a lot of new eyeballs on her at all times. And that was one of the main points of inspiration for creating The Moment , the British dance-pop star’s mockumentary that premiered on Jan. 30. The chaotic, Aidan Zamiri-directed film takes an exaggerated look at Charli’s fame-boosting Brat era, with the singer/songwriter telling Billboard in a video interview posted Monday (Feb. 2) that she was inspired by the “transition” she experienced in real life. Related Charli xcx & Aidan Zamiri Talk Meeting Meredith Marks, Wrecking Karaoke Rooms on Set for ‚ÄôThe Moment‚Äô | Billboard News Charli xcx Unveils ‘Wuthering Heights’ Tracklist Featuring Surprise Collab With Sky Ferreira Charli xcx’s ‘Brat’ Era Is a ‘Dead Horse’ She Can’t Stop Beating in ‘Residue’ Video Featuring a Major Celeb Cameo “I’d been this relatively niche artist, and then had suddenly been opened up to this huge new audience, some of whom really connected with me, some of whom only connected with aspects of me, some of wh‚Ä¶
